title: 'Added spice', SC says as Kangana withdraws plea over 'defamatory' tweet during farmers' protest
content: Ranaut moved the apex court challenging an order of the Punjab and Haryana High Court which refused to quash the complaint against her.

title: Uttarakhand’s Tehri Garhwal to get facelift with $126.4 million; Centre, ADB signs loan agreement to promote tourism
content: Juhi Mukherjee, Joint Secretary, Department of Economic Affairs, said the ADB loan supports the government’s policy to position Uttarakhand as a diversified, all-weather tourism destination

title: Shiv Sena leader submits complaint to police; seeks FIR against Sanjay Raut
content: The move comes after MP Sanjay Raut commented that the situation prevailing in Nepal can happen in India too

title: Nepal mayors skip Kerala Urban Conclave amid political unrest
content: Mayors Krishna Hari Maharjan of Tarakeshwor municipality, Bhim Prasad of Nilkantha municipality and Prahlad Sapkota of Ratnanagar municipality have skipped the conclave in Kochi

title: Gram Panchayat member arrested for killing man over trivial row in Karnataka’s Madhugiri
content: The villagers said the accused and the deceased belong to different caste and had differences since ages which led to the murder

title: Punjab floods: Gujarat sends train carrying relief material
content: The 22-wagon train carried 400 metric tonnes of food supplies, including wheat flour, rice, onions, potatoes, edible oil, sugar, and milk powder

title: Kerala’s IT exports near ₹1 lakh crore; start-ups grow 21-fold in 9 years, says Pinarayi at Kerala Urban Conclave
content: Kerala CM says interventions are being made from campus level with the aim of creating a skilled workforce

title: FIR against Vijayapura MLA Basanagouda Patil Yatnal for provocative speech in Maddur in south Karnataka
content: The suo moto case against the Vijayapura MLA follows a similar FIR registered against BJP MLC C. T. Ravi on September 11

title: Watch | The Prime Minister in Manipur on September 13: Too late for peace?
content: Since May 2023, Manipur has been gripped by ethnic clashes between the Kuki-Zo and Meitei communities, leading to over 250 deaths and 60,000 displaced.

title: Tamil film producers, FEFSI resolve dispute after mediation by retired judge of Madras High Court
content: They file a joint compromise memo stating that they have agreed to enter into a fresh MoU with regard to wages and other work conditions

title: Mysterious malady strikes Guntur village
content: Turakapalem, a quiet village of over 2000 residents in Guntur district, reported 29 deaths in just five months, prompting the government to declare a health emergency and send teams to collect blood samples of all the residents. Sambasiva Rao M. visits the village and finds a people desperate for answers.

title: Jagdeep Chhokar: a relentless pursuer of democratic reforms
content: Since his retirement, he had also been associated with ‘Aajeevika’ Bureau for over a decade, working on internal migration related issues

title: In Bihar, raids conducted at six locations against two government officials in a disproportionate assets case
content: The raids were conducted against one officer of education department and another engineer of rural works department

title: Govt informs SC of high-level meet to set up courts to exclusively try offences under special laws
content: Trial proceedings under special statutes cannot be delayed due to the overwhelming pendency in regular courts, says Bench

title: Bus carrying school children in Bengaluru tilts after wheel gets stuck in pothole on Balagere-Panathur Road
content: Local residents recalled repeated complaints about potholes, incomplete drains, and flooding along the stretch. According to them, even after Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah inspected the road earlier this year, no lasting solution was taken up

title: Uddhav’s Shiv Sena to launch ‘Majha Kumkum Majha Desh’ protest against Indo-Pak Match
content: Shiv Sena (UBT)‘s women wing to send sindoor to Mr. Modi on the day Indian cricket team will take on Pakistan in Asia Cup

title: Kerala CM pays tribute to late Sitaram Yechury on his first death anniversary
content: In a Facebook post, Pinarayi Vijayan says Yechury played a decisive role in shaping many political movements that influenced national politics and was the strongest spokesperson for the secular groups in the country

title: India, European Union reaffirm commitment to early conclusion of FTA talks: Piyush Goyal
content: In an social media post on X, Union Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal wrote that a balanced and mutually beneficial FTA will unlock new opportunities

title: In Bengal, BJP bets on ‘people’s sport‘ for people’s votes
content: Narendra Cup football tournament, a new outreach initiative of  West Bengal BJP comes months before 2026 Assembly elections in the State

title: Congress alleges FRA violations in Adani coal mine project in Madhya Pradesh
content: Earlier this month, Adani Power said it has received the Coal Ministry approval to commence mining operations at Dhirauli mine in Singrauli district of Madhya Pradesh

title: BJD suspends ex-Odisha minister Prafulla Kumar Mallik for anti-party activities
content: The party’s action came a day after Mr. Mallik, considered to be a close confidant of BJD president Naveen Patnaik, said that he might quit the regional outfit if it does not function properly

title: SC asks Centre why disabled candidates are allocated reserved seats even when they score above cut-off marks
content: The judgment points out that this inevitably prevents disabled candidates who have scored lesser marks a berth in the reserved category for PwD.

title: Bengaluru metro facilitates organ transport for second time
content: In August, for the first time, Namma Metro had successfully facilitated the transportation of an organ

title: Delhi Police bust Pakistan-linked terror module; five arrested
content: Additional Commissioner of Police (Special Cell) Pramod Kushwaha said the group was radicalised online by a Pakistan-based handler and was allegedly planning to acquire land and wage jihad in India

title: Amid eviction drive, move to acquire wetland grazing field in Assam raises hackles
content: The Dorabeel Village Grazing Field Protection Convening Committee has sniffed mischief in a revised notification inviting objections from people who would be affected by a proposed logistics park

title: Indian-origin motel manager from Karnataka beheaded in U.S.; co-worker arrested
content: Surveillance footage showed Cobos-Martinez retrieving a machete and attacking Chandra Mouli Nagamallaiah

title: West Bengal schools recruitment: Aspiring teachers protest outside Assembly; clash with police
content: Protestors claim that more than 50,000 vacant teachers posts in government schools; West Bengal Education Minister Bratya Basu says no such figures available

title: Face of Gen Z protests in Nepal and front-runner for PM post Balendra Shah studied in Karnataka
content: The 35-year-old politician pursued an M. Tech course in structural engineering at Nitte Meenakshi Institute of Technology in Bengaluru

title: Helios eyes 39% growth in East with festive launches
content: Helios said the company plans to “add roughly 50 stores nationally this financial year”; for the festive season in West Bengal, the company has launched a line-up with 14 global brands

title: Delhi riots case hearing highlights: Supreme Court adjourns hearing of bail pleas of student activists to September 19
content: A Division Bench of the Delhi High Court had termed their role in the alleged conspiracy “grave” while rejecting bail

title: Be accessible to people and work with empathy, Chandrababu Naidu advises Collectors
content: While underscoring the pivotal role they play in ensuring the success of government initiatives, the Chief Minister stresses the need for proactive, accountable, and people-centric approach

title: Opposition slams Mohan Majhi Govt for transferring more financial power to officers
content: “Since most Panchayat Samiti chairperson posts are held by BJD, the BJP government is attempting to weaken their powers,” charged senior BJD leader Arun Kumar Sahoo

title: DGQA to set up Centre of Excellence for drones in Hyderabad
content: Director General of Quality Assurance N. Manoharan, in his keynote address, highlighted the growing role of drones in modern warfare and stressed the need for robust quality assurance frameworks to ensure reliability in combat conditions.

title: Is Voter Adhikar Yatra making a difference on the ground? | Explained
content: The yatra highlights flaws in Bihar’s SIR of electoral rolls, energising INDIA bloc while raising anxiety among voters; BLOs remain stretched, BLAs disengaged, leaving many uncertain about inclusion on the electoral lists

title: Trump’s tariff heat scalds garment industry, other sectors in Karnataka
content: Facing rising costs, falling orders, and mounting pressure from global competitors, MSMEs in the State have to now grapple with the tariffs imposed by U.S. President Donald Trump, which are likely to cripple various sectors, particularly the garment industry, finds out Mini Tejaswi. However, trade bodies bat for new markets such as Vietnam, Indonesia, South Korea

title: OBC youth allegedly dies over Maratha reservation
content: “Since the government had issued a GR on September 2 to issue Kunbi certificates to Marathas, he went into a state of shock. He was worried about what would happen to his children,” said a source

title: Uttar Pradesh Congress president alleges house arrest during PM Modi’s Varanasi tour
content: Around 100 Congress and Samajwadi Party (SP) workers were also put under house arrest in Varanasi to stop a proposed protest against alleged vote fraud in the Prime Minister’s presence in Varanasi.

title:
Tracing the history of colonial powers
in Tamil land through charts, maps
content: European sailors prepared maps and diagrams mainly for space and direction. But they have so far remained unused. Recently, 1,862 maps of forts, armouries, granaries, mints, and treasuries — selected from the Tamil Nadu State Archives — have been uploaded on Tamil Digital Library. They will be the invaluable resources for researchers

title: The hands behind the golu dolls of Bommaikara Theru in Kancheepuram
content: Asthagiri street, known as Bommaikara Theru, in Kancheepuram was once filled with doll makers whose craft defined Navaratri. Today, only a handful of families remain, balancing tradition with changing demand and rising expenses.

title: The caste tensions that sparked after T.N. Scheduled Caste activist Immanuel Sekaran’s murder in 1957
content: The events, starting with riots at Mudukulathur, continue to dominate the public discourse. While the Scheduled Castes were among the adversely impacted people, police firing at Keezhathooval, wherein five persons belonging to the Mukkulathors were killed, confounded the situation. Clarity is still not available on every aspect of the episode

title: The anxious, ‘absent’ migrant voters of Gopalganj
content: Gopalganj district has the highest number of names deleted from the draft electoral list, with voters declared ‘absent’ or ‘permanently shifted’, though many migrants still want to register as electors

title: Bhanumathi: a multi-faceted star of Tamil, Telugu cinema
content: P. Bhanumathi was not just about acting. She directed and produced 16 films and wrote screenplays, dialogues, and scripts. She composed music. She sang all the songs in her films and included one keerthana of Thyagaraja mostly in her Telugu movies

title: Swades Foundation reshaping rural India through mindset change
content: Guided by the motto, ‘Swa Se Bane Des’ or ‘I make my own country,’ the Foundation today works across over 1,300 villages across Maharashtra, building a model of empowerment that is sustainable, and community led

title: TMC charges Union Minister and BJP leader with disrespecting Rabindranath Tagore’s photograph
content: TMC highlighted a photograph of the poet which was allegedly placed at the feet of  Union Minister Sukanta Majumdar. The BJP leader said that the portrait of the poet was not placed on the stage but at a distance

title: Police diary with no specific acts cannot be ground to detain a person: Jammu and Kashmir High Court quashes PSA
content: The advocates who appeared for the accused informed the court that the entire material forming the basis of the grounds of detention “was neither supplied nor explained to him in the language he understands”

title: Madhya Pradesh High Court notice to government authorities over death of infants after rat bites at Indore hospital
content: On August 30 and 31, the two girls were gnawed upon by rats inside the NICU of the MY Hospital, one of Madhya Pradesh’s largest government-run medical facility

title: Railway Minister announces parcel train to transport apples from Kashmir to Delhi
content: The move comes as a relief to orchardists in south Kashmir, where hundreds of trucks laden with apple produce worth ₹200 crore are stranded due to the closure of the Srinagar-Jammu national highway for the past 13 days following landslips triggered by heavy rains

title: Supreme Court upholds Bar Council’s fee for All India Bar Examination
content: Petitioner claims the fee charged by BCI was in violation of Section 24(1) (f) of Advocates Act, 1961 and infringed on the fundamental rights under Articles 19(1)(g) and 14 of Constitution

title: Standard of debates in legislatures, Parliament should improve: Om Birla
content: The Lok Sabha Speaker urges lawmakers to rise above party lines on issues of national interest and meet the aspirations of people

title: Ties with India one of the top U.S. has today: Rubio
content: U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio said that in the 21st Century, the “story is going to be written in the Indo-Pacific”; he said the India-U.S. relationship is going through an “extraordinary transition”

title: Semiconductors are silent engines driving innovation, says APSCHE chief
content: The government is eager to harness the semiconductor frontier through India-centric innovation, strategic collaboration, and a future-ready infra, says Madhu Murthy

title: Special Cabinet meeting on September 16 to discuss UKP-III
content: State government to arrive at a decision on land acquisition for the project; the government intends to provide justice to the farmers, says H.K. Patil

title: A.P. Governor calls for lifelong learning at Amrita Vishwa Vidyapeetham convocation
content: Nazeer lauds the institution’s achievements in global rankings, sustainability initiatives, and international research collaborations

title: 144 Telugus stranded in Nepal return to A.P.
content: Of the total, 104 people alights at Visakhaptnam airport; the flight continue its journey to Tirupati with the remaining 40 passengers

title: Indian Railways focusing on providing more connectivity to North Eastern States
content: Indian Railways has taken up several projects in the hilly terrains connecting the capital cities of Manipur and Nagaland, say officials

title: Structures erected to greet Modi pulled down in Manipur’s Churachandpur
content: Earlier, Kuki-Zo bodies welcomed the Prime Minister’s visit but opposed the inclusion of a dance programme in the official function

title: Kannada filmmaker S. Narayan, family booked for dowry harassment
content: According to a complaint by Pavithra, wife of Pavan, they got married in 2021, and at that time, Pavan was unemployed so she used to take care of the household expenses and even gifted him a car

title: The invisible children in Chengara’s protest land
content: Around 200 children live in abominable conditions in Chengara, the site of a long-standing protest in Kerala, a State that takes pride in its child development indices. The settlement lacks electricity, piped water connections, and proper roads. K.S. Sudhi and Hiran Unnikrishnan chronicle the plight of these children.

title: Diarrhoea cases in Vijayawada go up to 102, no clarity yet on causes
content: No deaths reported, says Minister; reports of water samples sent to Institute of Preventive Medicine awaited; control room set up at the Collectorate

title: SSB detains 63 Nepal prison escapees; some claim to be Indians
content: A woman inmate who was apprehended at Kishanganj along the Bihar border was handed over to the police

title: Supreme Court Collegium proposes Chief Justices to three High Courts
content: The Collegium has recommended Justice Soumen Sen as Chief Justice of Meghalaya High Court; Patna HC Acting Chief Justice P.B. Bajanthri was recommended as its regular Chief Justice; Justice M. Sundar was recommended as the Chief Justice of Manipur High Court

title: C.P. Radhakrishnan to take oath as the new Vice-President on September 12
content: Mr. Radhakrishnan, according to sources, has also called a meeting of all floor leaders of Rajya Sabha

title: Packers continue impressive start to season with victory over Commanders
content: Remember when the Packers couldn't beat any playoff-caliber teams? Not anymore, after their last two wins.

title: Ekeler feared to have torn Achilles, sources say
content: The Commanders fear veteran RB Austin Ekeler tore his right Achilles in the fourth quarter of Thursday night's 27-18 loss to the Packers, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter. He'll undergo additional testing Friday.

title: WR Reed breaks collarbone in Packers' victory
content: Packers receiver Jayden Reed broke his collarbone on a play that didn't count during the opening drive of Thursday's 27-18 win against the Commanders at Lambeau Field.

title: Collier states MVP case with rare 50-40-90 year
content: Lynx forward Napheesa Collier made her MVP case Thursday night, becoming just the second player in WNBA history to finish a regular season with a 50-40-90 shooting split.

title: Judge belts 2 HRs, ties DiMaggio on Yanks' list
content: Just two days after passing Yogi Berra on the Yankees' all-time home run list, Aaron Judge hit two home runs Thursday to tie Joe DiMaggio for fourth with 361 career home runs.

title: Aces close with record 22 3s in 16th straight win
content: The Aces head into the playoffs with a full head of steam after hitting a WNBA record 22 3-pointers in their 16th consecutive win Thursday night in their regular-season finale.

title: Trout ends career-long drought with 399th homer
content: Mike Trout hit his first homer since Aug. 6, launching the 399th blast of his career Thursday night in a 7-6 loss to the Mariners.

title: Report links Kawhi's late pay to Clippers partner
content: A Clippers limited partner invested $1.99 million in Aspiration nine days before the company made an overdue $1.75 million payment to Kawhi Leonard, according to a report.

title: Costa Rica hotel raided in Gardner investigation
content: Authorities in Costa Rica on Thursday raided the hotel in which the 14-year-old son of former Yankees outfielder Brett Gardner was found dead.

content: Matt Bowen looks at those who underwhelmed in Week 1 and decides whether it was a sign of things to come.

content: It's not only hockey's best rivalry, but one of the nastiest in all of sports. We debate who makes the cut.

content: Who could be on the hot seat? Who are coaching candidates to watch? Our experts explain the current coaching landscape.

content: Timothy Bradley Jr. shares his thoughts on the Canelo Alvarez-Terence Crawford fight and explains how they can win.

content: Chelsea FC have been charged with 74 breaches of FA rules relating to alleged agent payments. But what exactly are they accused of, and what could it cost them?

title: 'I think the players knew it was important': How the U.S. is using this week in Napa to prepare for the Ryder Cup
content: With the Ryder Cup just a few weeks away, U.S. captain Keegan Bradley is using this week's PGA Tour event in Napa as a tuneup for what's ahead at Bethpage Black.

title: Expert picks, best bets: Will Silva end the Fighting Nerds' losing streak at Noche UFC?
content: Din Thomas and Anthony Smith pick the Noche UFC main event between Diego Lopes and Jean Silva. Ian Parker gives his value picks for the card.

title: Vikings QB J.J. McCarthy leaves team to accompany fiancée Katya Kuropas in child's birth
content: The Minnesota Vikings quarterback left the team on Thursday to be with his fiancée ahead of their child's birth.

title: Should you bet on Mateer or Moore to win the Heisman?
content: As odds shift for the Heisman Trophy and national title, Pamela Maldonado explains how to bet each of them.

title: Fantasy Basketball 101: Why this is the year to play, even if you never have before
content: Thinking about trying out fantasy basketball for the first time this season? Here is everything you need to know, so you can join in on the fun.

title: The John Cena eras: From Ruthless Aggression to 17-time WWE champ
content: We highlight the key moments from Cena's remarkable 23-year career before he retires the jorts in December.

title: The strangely specific transfer obsessions of elite clubs, and what the summer window taught us about them
content: Every team has preferences when it comes to transfers ... but some are more surprising than others. What did we learn this summer about Real Madrid's, Arsenal's and other elite clubs' fixations?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Madrid eye move for Stuttgart's Stiller
content: Real Madrid are reportedly keeping tabs on a possible move for VfB Stuttgart midfielder Angelo Stiller.

title: How to win your league: Expert picks, backup plans and more
content: If you read only one fantasy hockey story, read this one: your guide to draft, play and win your league like an expert.

title: Who's the No. 1 player in the girls' 2026, 2027 and 2028 classes?
content: Are Saniyah Hall, Kaleena Smith and Tatianna Griffin safe at No. 1 in the 2026, 2027 and 2028 classes, respectively?

title: Hall of Fame inductee Carmelo Anthony's NBA 2K ratings through the years
content: For Carmelo Anthony's induction into the Basketball Hall of Fame, here's a look at how much of a force he was throughout NBA 2K.

title: "Stooping To New Lows": BJP On AI Video Of PM's Mother, Congress Doubles Down
content: As the controversy over the AI video on Prime Minister Narendra Modi's mother snowballed on Friday, the Congress doubled down and said there was no disrespect to anybody and claimed it was about a parent educating her child.

title: Trump To Award Charlie Kirk Presidential Medal Of Freedom Posthumously: What Is It
content: Charlie Kirk, the conservative activist who was shot dead, will be honoured with the Presidential Medal of Freedom, the highest civilian honour, posthumously, US President Donald Trump announced at the Pentagon on Thursday.

title: "Tamil Nadu Not Bihar, Such Tricks Won't Work Here": DMK On Poll Roll Revision
content: Senior DMK leader and State Minister Durai Murugan on Thursday dismissed the proposition of 'Special Intensive Revision' in Tamil Nadu, asserting that the state is not like Bihar and here people were "politically aware" and could not be misled.

title: CCTV Shows Motel Staff Chase, Behead Indian Man In Front Of Wife, Teen Son
content: An Indian man from Karnataka was brutally beheaded by a Cuban immigrant with a violent criminal history-recently released from custody-at a motel in Dallas, Texas.

title: Nepal Protest LIVE Updates: Indian Woman Killed As Protesters Set Hotel On Fire
content: A 57-year-old woman from Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad, Rajesh Gola, died after jumping from a hotel set ablaze during violent protests in Nepal. Gola, with her husband, was on a multi-day trip when their hotel, Hyatt Regency, caught fire.

title: Delhi High Court Evacuated, Searches On After Bomb Threat Email
content: The Delhi High Court on Friday received a bomb threat, forcing the evacuation of judges, lawyers, and other staff from the court premises.

title: Karnataka Man Stabs Woman On Her Birthday For Refusing Marriage Proposal
content: In a shocking case, a man allegedly stabbed a woman on her birthday after she refused his marriage proposal in Karnataka's Udupi district, said police on Friday.

title: Indian Woman Dies Trying To Escape Kathmandu Hotel Set On Fire By Protesters
content: Rajesh Gola had gone to Nepal, which faced deadly anti-government protests this week, with her husband, Ramvir Singh Gola.

title: "Take It Seriously": BJP To Congress On Rahul Gandhi's 'Security Lapses'
content: CRPF alleged that Rahul Gandhi was not taking his security cover "seriously" as he was mostly travelling abroad "without informing anyone".

title: "Has Time To Go To Malaysia...": BJP On Rahul Gandhi Skipping Veep Oath
content: The BJP has targeted senior Congress leader Rahul Gandhi for skipping the swearing-in ceremony of CP Radhakrishnan as India's 15th Vice President.

title: 3 Of A Family Die In Sikkim Landslide, Granddaughter, 7, Rescued Alive
content: A landslide struck Upper Rimbi in West Sikkim's Yangthang constituency around midnight, claiming three lives and leaving three others missing. The incident occurred amid continuous heavy rainfall in the region.

title: Delhi Student Attacked With Blade By Teen Girls After Argument In School
content: A girl was allegedly attacked with a blade by a group of teen girls in Delhi's Rohini following an argument, police said on Thursday.

title: Indian Manager's Beheading In US: Documents Reveal Grisly Details
content: Chandra Mouli Nagamallaiah, the 50-year-old Indian motel manager beheaded by his employee in Dallas, was attacked because the killer was upset that he did not speak directly to him and told another staff member to translate instructions.

title: Indian Man Beheaded In US Motel After Argument Over Washing Machine
content: An Indian man was attacked with a machete and beheaded, allegedly after an argument with his employee at a motel in the US city of Dallas.

title: CP Radhakrishnan Takes Oath As 15th Vice President, J Dhankhar Present
content: Vice-President, Oath ceremony: Chandrapuram Ponnusamy Radhakrishnan on Friday took oath as the 15th Vice President of India at a ceremony held at Rashtrapati Bhawan in New Delhi.

title: J Dhankhar's First Public Appearance Since Exit, At Successor's Swearing-In
content: Former Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar on Friday attended the swearing-in ceremony of his successor, C P Radhakrishnan, his first public appearance since his sudden exit last month.

title: India's IT Sector Nervous As US Proposes 25% Outsourcing Tax
content: A US Republican Senator has introduced the HIRE Act, which proposes taxing companies that hire foreign workers over Americans.

title: Video: JD Vance Carries Assassinated Charlie Kirk's Casket Aboard Air Force Two
content: US Vice President JD Vance carried the casket of conservative activist Charlie Kirk, along with other pallbearers, on the airport tarmac.

title: Despite Trump's Push For Nobel Peace Prize, Committee Says It Won't Be Swayed
content: Donald Trump's obsession with winning the Nobel Peace Prize next month may have hit a hitch -- the stubborn independence of the Norwegian Nobel Committee, which insisted to AFP that it cannot be swayed.

title: ISIS Terrorists Planned On Targeting Right Wing Leaders, Reveal Chats: Sources
content: The five suspected ISIS operatives, who were arrested in a joint operation spread across different states, were planning to target some right-wing leaders, an investigation into their chats revealed.

title: Indian-origin man beheaded: How a washing machine spat led to grisly murder; killer seen kicking severed head
content: In a horrific incident, a Dallas motel manager, Chandra Nagamallaiah, was beheaded by Yordanis Cobos-Martinez after an argument over a broken washing machine. The gruesome attack occurred in front of the victim's family, with the suspect later arrested wearing a blood-soaked T-shirt. ICE officials stated Cobos-Martinez, a Cuban national with a criminal history, should not have been in the U.S.

title: 'You added spice': SC on Kangana's post during farmers' protest
content: The Supreme Court criticized Kangana Ranaut for adding her own commentary to a retweet concerning the 2020-21 farmers' protests, leading her to withdraw her plea seeking to quash a defamation complaint. The court suggested she pursue alternative remedies in the trial court. The case stems from Ranaut's remarks about a woman protester, which the complainant alleges were defamatory.

title: Delhi HC evacuated after bomb threat; email warns of blast after mid-day Friday prayers
content: The Delhi High Court was evacuated on Friday following an email threat claiming a bomb would detonate in a judge's chamber after midday Islamic prayers. The email, purportedly from Kanimozhi Thevidiya, alleged a conspiracy involving Pakistani ISI cells and a plan to recreate the 1998 Coimbatore blasts.

title: 'Sabnike pranaam': MEA's Randhir Jaiswal greets Mauritius PM in Bhojpuri - watch video
content: External Affairs Ministry spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal welcomed Mauritius Prime Minister Navinchandra Ramgoolam in Varanasi, speaking in Bhojpuri to highlight the deep cultural ties. Prime Minister Modi emphasized the spiritual connection between the two nations, rooted in shared traditions. The leaders discussed enhanced cooperation in various sectors, reinforcing the strategic partnership and India's commitment to its 'Neighbourhood First' policy.

title: Microsoft CEO admits ‘lack of empathy’: Tells staff in meeting; ‘We will do better’
content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella acknowledged the need to rebuild employee trust following layoffs and a return-to-office mandate. He addressed concerns about a perceived lack of empathy and committed to improvement.

title: Umar Khalid calls FIR in Delhi riots case a 'joke'
content: Umar Khalid's legal team has dismissed the UAPA case FIR concerning the 2020 Delhi riots as a "joke" during court proceedings. Advocate Trideep Pais argued the FIR lacks legal sanctity, questioning its connection to the alleged conspiracy. He cited court observations from other riots cases, alleging investigative bias and fabricated evidence against Khalid.

title: Prince Harry's 'surprise visit' to Kyiv: Duke pledges support for wounded soldiers
content: Prince Harry made a surprise visit to Kyiv, responding to an invitation from the Ukrainian government to support the rehabilitation of wounded military personnel. Accompanied by the Invictus Games Foundation, he aims to launch initiatives aiding recovery, emphasizing the importance of humanizing those affected by the conflict. Ukraine has integrated sports into its veteran policy, with over 22,000 veterans accessing related benefits.

title: Tata chip plant’s wild problem: Snakes, elephants on site; how it’s managed
content: Tata Electronics is constructing an "Elephant-Proof" wall around its new chip assembly plant in Assam to mitigate ground vibrations caused by elephants, which could disrupt the precision required for semiconductor manufacturing. The project also addresses a snake problem with a dedicated rescue team.

title: Noida dowry death case: Court rejects bail pleas of Nikki’s husband & in-laws
content: A court in Noida has denied bail to the husband and in-laws of Nikki Bhati, who died from severe burns following allegations of dowry harassment. The family is accused of setting Nikki on fire, but the defense claims a cylinder blast caused the incident, presenting CCTV footage as evidence.

title: Solar Eclipse 2025: List of nations to witness 'Surya Grahan'; timings & safety tips
content: The solar eclipse on September 21, 2025, a partial eclipse, will be visible in the Southern Hemisphere, including Australia, New Zealand, and Antarctica. India will miss direct visibility, but can view it via live streams. At its peak, nearly 85% of the Sun will be covered, offering a dramatic view for those within the path of visibility.

title: India pushes back against Trump pressure: Russia crude imports rise
content: In August, India's Russian crude oil imports neared China's, reaching €2.9 billion. The US has pressured India to reduce these purchases, even imposing tariffs on Indian exports. Despite this, India defends its position, highlighting that China, the EU, and others continue to import substantial amounts of Russian energy.

title: AI could slash drug discovery: DeepMind CEO Hassabis reveals; global healthcare
content: Demis Hassabis, CEO of DeepMind, revealed that AI can drastically shorten drug discovery timelines, potentially reducing years of research to months. DeepMind's AI models streamline drug candidate identification, enhance precision, and lower failure rates. This breakthrough promises faster access to treatments, reduced costs, and a new era of AI-powered medical research.

title: Dallas horror: Who is Yordanis Cobos-Martinez? Suspect behind Indian man's beheading
content: In a horrific incident at a Dallas motel, Yordanis Cobos-Martinez allegedly beheaded his co-worker, Chandra Nagamallaiah, following an argument. Cobos-Martinez, a migrant worker with a prior criminal record, was apprehended at the scene while carrying the machete. ICE confirmed he had been previously released under supervision due to lack of deportation flights.

title: 2 Nepal jail fugitives enter India, cops simply hand them over to their families in UP
content: Two Indian men, Chitranjan Sarkar and Ranjan Vishwas, who escaped from a Nepal prison, were briefly detained by Indian border security before being released to their families. Despite an extradition treaty between India and Nepal, authorities cited the absence of crimes committed on Indian soil as the reason for their release.

title: 'This is not him': Gukesh loses third game in a row at Grand Swiss; Sarin in joint-lead
content: D Gukesh faced another setback at the FIDE Grand Swiss, losing to Ediz Gurel, while Nihal Sarin joined Matthias Bluebaum in the lead. Several Indian players, including Praggnanandhaa, secured victories, improving their standings. Vaishali Rameshbabu took the sole lead in the women's section, increasing her chances to qualify for the Candidates tournament.

title: 'He was a good man': Trump slams Jair Bolsonaro verdict
content: Donald Trump has strongly criticized Brazil's Supreme Court for sentencing Jair Bolsonaro to over 27 years in prison for allegedly attempting to overturn the 2022 election. Trump, calling the ruling “very surprising,” hinted at possible sanctions against Brazil, a move condemned by Secretary of State Marco Rubio.

title: Charlie Kirk shooting: FBI drops new pics, videos of suspect - 10 things to know
content: Charlie Kirk, prominent conservative figure and Turning Point USA co-founder, was fatally shot while discussing gun violence at Utah Valley University. The FBI is seeking a suspect, offering a $100,000 reward, and has released images of a person of interest. Political figures across the spectrum have condemned the attack, with tributes pouring in for Kirk.

title: Charlie Kirk shooting: Patrick Mahomes quiet; Randi Mahomes, Tavia Hunt speaks out
content: Following the tragic shooting death of Charlie Kirk at Utah Valley University, Patrick Mahomes has remained silent. Tavia Hunt, wife of the Chiefs owner, expressed grief and called for civility, a sentiment echoed by Patrick's mother, Randi Mahomes, who shared Tavia's post. The investigation into Kirk's death is ongoing, sparking renewed debate about violence.

title: India gets new VP! CP Radhakrishnan takes oath as 15th vice-president; Dhankhar present
content: CP Radhakrishnan was sworn in as the 15th Vice-President of India at Rashtrapati Bhavan, with President Drapadi Murmu administering the oath. The ceremony was attended by prominent leaders, including Prime Minister Modi and former Vice-Presidents. Radhakrishnan, the NDA candidate, won the election with 452 votes against B Sudershan Reddy. The date was selected based on auspicious timing.

title: Nepal Gen Z protests: 12k+ prisoners at large; uncertainty over interim PM continues – Key points
content: Nepal witnessed Gen Z protests that led to government collapse. Thirty-four people died and over a thousand were injured. The protests started due to social media ban. Sushila Karki is likely to become caretaker prime minister. Balen Shah supports Karki. Over twelve thousand prisoners escaped during the unrest. Curfew timings have been relaxed. Protesters demand end to corruption and favouritism.

title: Dallas: Indian-origin man beheaded at motel in front of wife & son; suspect arrested
content: In a shocking incident at a Dallas motel, 50-year-old Chandramouli Nagamallaiah, an Indian-origin man, was brutally beheaded in front of his family. The suspect, Yordanis Cobos-Martinez, a motel employee, has been arrested and charged with capital murder. The gruesome attack reportedly stemmed from a dispute over a broken washing machine.

title: Jayden Reed injury: Packers star suffers broken collarbone in opening season
content: The Green Bay Packers defeated the Washington Commanders 27-18, but the victory was overshadowed by a significant injury. Wide receiver Jayden Reed suffered a broken collarbone on the opening drive, casting doubt on his season availability. Despite Reed's absence, the Packers managed to secure the win, highlighting both their resilience and the impact of the injury on their offense.

title: Filmmaker S Narayan & family booked after daughter-in-law files dowry harassment case
content: Sandalwood director S Narayan, his wife Bhagyavati, and son Pavan face legal trouble after Pavan's wife, Pavitra, filed a dowry harassment case. Pavitra alleges she was forced to provide dowry, support her jobless husband, and financially assist the family's film academy. Police have issued notices to Narayan and his family, directing them to appear for investigation regarding the allegations.

title: Trump for Nobel Prize? Peace panel says decision based on merit
content: Despite Donald Trump's repeated claims and endorsements from foreign leaders, the Norwegian Nobel Committee asserts its independence in selecting the Peace Prize laureate. The committee emphasizes that media attention and public campaigns do not influence their evaluation process, focusing solely on nominees' merits and contributions to peace. Experts suggest Trump's chances are low, citing his policies contrasting with Nobel's principles of multilateralism.

title: Price prediction: Gold may find support at Rs 1,09,000. What's the outlook for today?
content: Gold price prediction today: Jateen Trivedi of LKP Securities suggests a 'buy on dips' strategy for gold investors, citing bullish trends. Gold futures are resilient near ₹1,08,979, awaiting US economic data. Technical indicators support buying near ₹1,09,000 with a stop-loss at ₹1,08,600, targeting ₹1,10,000, as EMAs hold firm and MACD confirms bullish signals.

title: 'Asked us to get rid of Israel': Cycling team to change name; protests expected in Canada
content: Cycling team Israel-Premier Tech will race under the name IPT in Canada this week to avoid potential pro-Palestinian protests. Organizers confirmed the team requested the removal of "Israel" from their branding for the Quebec and Montreal races. This decision follows similar demonstrations that disrupted the Vuelta a Espana, prompted by the ongoing conflict in Gaza.

title: China rare earth curbs: Indian automakers strained as magnet exports yet to resume
content: Despite China easing rare earth export restrictions, Indian automakers still face critical magnet supply shortages, impacting production. Ashok Leyland and TVS Motor Co. are managing the shortfall daily, while others like Maruti Suzuki and Mahindra & Mahindra remain unaffected for now. The situation highlights India's reliance on Chinese supplies, prompting efforts to diversify through international agreements and overseas asset acquisition.

title: Charlie Kirk assassination: New FBI video shows suspect leaping off building to escape
content: The FBI and Utah authorities released a video of the suspect in Charlie Kirk's fatal shooting, showing him fleeing across a Utah Valley University building. Utah Governor Spencer Cox reported over 7,000 tips received, highlighting law enforcement's dedication. Officials are preparing to pursue the death penalty, while a video surfaced showing a man resembling the suspect limping nearby.

title: Kathmandu hotel set on fire, Ghaziabad woman falls to death
content: An arson attack on a Kathmandu hotel, following protests against the Nepal government, resulted in the death of a 55-year-old woman from Ghaziabad. Rajesh Devi Singh Gola fell while attempting to escape the burning hotel using makeshift ropes. Her husband, Ramveer Singh Gola, was injured during the escape. The Indian Embassy and local administration are assisting the family.

title: Delhi court grants bail to actor Ashish Kapoor in alleged rape case
content: Delhi's Tis Hazari Court granted bail to TV actor Ashish Kapoor, arrested in connection with an alleged rape case in Pune. The court considered CCTV footage, Kapoor's cooperation, and his permanent residency in Delhi while granting bail. Advocates argued the complainant was intoxicated and had a history of filing complaints, while co-accused individuals had already received bail.

title: UP man murdered by in-laws for marrying against wishes
content: In Lucknow, Shani Rawat, 24, was murdered by his in-laws for marrying against their wishes. Police arrested Santosh Yadav and Devesh Yadav, the alleged masterminds. The family's anger escalated after the couple had a child, leading to the brutal attack with iron rods near Sisendi Road. The body was dumped in a drain to conceal evidence.

title: 'Kohli shaped my game': Gill opens up on cricket journey; shares philosophy on leadership
content: Shubman Gill credits Virat Kohli's passion and hunger for shaping his cricketing approach, emphasizing that drive surpasses talent. Gill also draws inspiration from Stoicism to manage pressure, focusing on sincere effort over recognition. He blends Kohli's intensity with philosophical principles, guiding his career alongside his love for music and routines.

title: 20-year-old youth stabbed over affair with girl, body found in ditch in Bengaluru
content: In Jayanagar, a love triangle turned deadly when Kiran Gowda, 20, was fatally stabbed during a fight with Jeevan, 20, over Divya, 19. Divya and Kiran were in a relationship after she broke up with Jeevan seven months prior.

title: Tamannaah Bhatia pens note on becoming a 'better partner' after breakup with Vijay Varma
content: Tamannaah Bhatia is rethinking life and love. She wants to be a great life partner. This comes after her reported breakup with Vijay Varma in early 2025. They started dating after meeting on Lust Stories 2. Tamannaah is currently promoting her new show, Do You Wanna Partner, with Diana Penty. The show premieres on September 12.

title: Vegetarian woman ‘kills self’ after drunk husband cooks chicken in UP
content: In Amroha district's Vanshiwala village, Reena Singh, 21, allegedly died by suicide after her husband cooked chicken against her wishes. Her family suspects foul play, alleging dowry harassment and murder. Police arrested her husband, brother-in-law, and cousin, recovering a dupatta. The husband confessed to disposing of the body in the Ganga after finding her hanging.

title: Sikkim landslide: Four dead, three missing in Yangthang; rescue ops under way
content: A devastating landslide in Upper Rimbi, West Sikkim, claimed the lives of at least four people and left three others missing. The tragedy struck early Friday in Yangthang constituency, prompting a swift response from police, SSB personnel, and local villagers. Rescue efforts are ongoing to find the missing individuals amidst challenging conditions.

title: Bolsonaro sentenced to 27yrs: Brazil's SC convicts ex-president for coup attempt
content: Jair Bolsonaro, the former president of Brazil, has been sentenced to 27 years and three months in prison after being convicted by the Supreme Court for attempting a coup following his 2022 electoral defeat. The unprecedented ruling has sparked international backlash, particularly from the US, while inflaming political tensions within Brazil, with supporters claiming political persecution. Despite the ruling, Bolsonaro remains an influential figure.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens above 25,050; BSE Sensex up around 200 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Friday on the back of firm global cues. While Nifty50 was above 25,050, BSE Sensex was up almost 200 points.

title: ‘Priority to pull India away from China’: Trump envoy confident on trade deal
content: Sergio Gor, nominee for US Ambassador to India, emphasized the Trump administration's aim to strengthen ties with India, viewing it as a crucial partner against Chinese expansionism. Gor highlighted ongoing trade discussions, particularly regarding energy and market access, while acknowledging existing trade disputes.

title: Watch: JD Vance carries Charlie Kirk’s casket as it reaches Arizona on Air Force Two
content: Charlie Kirk's casket was flown to Arizona on Air Force Two, accompanied by Vice President JD Vance and his wife, Usha, following Kirk's tragic shooting death in Utah. Vance, a long-time friend of Kirk, assisted in carrying the casket. The FBI is offering a $100,000 reward for information on the shooter, who remains at large.

title: Kaylee Hartung: Is the TNF reporter married or single? Details on her personal life
content: Kaylee Hartung returns as the sideline reporter for Amazon Prime Video's Thursday Night Football, marking her fourth season alongside Al Michaels and Kirk Herbstreit. While fans are curious about her personal life, Hartung remains unmarried and focused on her career, balancing NFL coverage with her role at NBC's Today Show.

title: Asia Cup: 'We have best spinner in the world' – Pakistan coach fires warning at India
content: As Pakistan gears up for the Asia Cup, coach Mike Hesson acknowledges India's confidence and strength, particularly their world-class spinners. He emphasizes Pakistan's focus on improving daily, highlighting the team's strong bowling attack led by Mohammad Nawaz. While recognizing the batting lineup's development, Hesson stresses the importance of collective performance in adapting to varying conditions in Dubai.

title: 'Reports of threats': US Naval Academy under lockdown; one person hurt
content: The US Naval Academy in Annapolis, Maryland, was placed on lockdown following reports of a potential threat, prompting a response from military personnel and local police. According to Fox News, an expelled former midshipman allegedly returned to campus armed, with reports of gunshots heard inside Bancroft Hall.
